title: Suddenly I cannot send or receive emails
content: I am using a PC with WIN 11 OS, Thunderbird version 115.3.2 Before 11:01 today Thunderbird was working without an issue. However after 11:01 today I am unable to receive emails. (see attach 1 - history). There are new emails on the Yahoo/ATT server - they are not downloading. (see attach 2 - imap). I worked through several articles in this forum and nothing worked. I found a checklist and went through it: > configured correctly - YES > Not blocked by filter - No blockage > Yes it was working until 11:01 today - no problems prior to this > No other problems (initially) > Exceeding email limits - NO When I tried to send an email, this error message appeared (attch 3 - smtp). Finally, about 20 minutes after that this error message appeared. (attach 4 - authentication) I am at a standstill. I use Thunderbird to manage my business emails. Please help me.
creator: lancebb

title: Why suddenly can I no longer copy emails directly from Thunderbird to Windows Live Mail ?
content: For years I have always been able to copy emails from Thunderbird folders (Inbox, Sent, etc) directly into Windows Live Mail in eml format. Suddenly I cannot do this. Instead of the email itself I now get a "new message" box appear and it simply contains a line like imap-message://username@btinternet.com@mail.btinternet.com/Sent#2039 or similar or mailbox-message://nobody@Local%20Folders/Active/1%20Gmail#2732 or similar (depending where I have copied or dragged it from) rather than the message. This is a very disturbing & distressing change. I know Windows Live Mail is not your product & is no longer supported anyway, but I keep loads of messages from my six email accounts stored in local folders for reference both within Thunderbird & WLM. For some reason I seem to now be able to reverse the process and copy direct from WLM to Thunderbird which has previously not been possible. I have Thunderbird 115.3.2 (32 bit) and Windows Live Mail 2012 I have Thunderbird set up as IMAP and WLM as POP. I have not knowingly changed anything and this change has come about of its own accord. I updated Import/Export Tools NG Add-On a couple of days ago as I was compelled to. Could this be the cause ? If so how can I reverse it ? Or is it something in the settings for this add-on (which I have attempted to capture a screenshot of & attach) Thank you for any help you can offer

title: Getting Message "Profile Missing ..." After Attempting Downgrade from 115 to 102.
content:
Earlier in the week I did a successful downgrade from 115 to 102. It ran fine. Then, stupidly, I got the message that an upgrade was available and I permitted it. Stupid, Stupid, Stupid! What I got, of course was a new 115 (I don't know what the sub version was). So I followed the same procedure as before to go back to 102. This time, when 102 started I got a message that my profile was modified by 115 and might not be usable in 102 (Or words like that.) and TB terminated. Now when I start 102 I get the attached image. Since I did a full disk backup just before this TB "upgrade" I thought I could restore the previous profile of the same name. That didn't work, same message. I went back and retrieved a week old version of the profile and same result. profiles.ini lists the same file as default.

Did this new version of 115 corrupt my profile?.......Intentionally!!! Or leave something under a rock to trick 102 to not be able to use that profile and even older backups?

Where can I go from here? 102 can't use the only profile I have ever had starting 15 or more years ago?
creator: petejc

title: Tbird migration to new PC not working despite following "Moving Thunderbird Data to a New Computer" instructions
content:
I'm back and forth between houses in two different cities. Up to this point I've used Teamviewer to check email on my main PC. That's become problematic so I wanted to install Tbird on the remote PC, copy the profile from the main PC to it and have everything on both PCs. Once setup I planned on using a sync service to keep them in sync (I already have this going for my docs).

The problem is Tbird on the remote doesn't recognize and import the profile from the main machine.

I installed ver 102.15.1, the same one on the main machine. After Tbird ran the first time I closed it without configuring anything.

I took the "Thunderbird" folder from %APPDATA%\Roaming off the main machine and pasted it into the same location on the remote machine.

When I open Tbird it goes into the setup for establishing an email account. It has my address book but nothing related to email, no accounts, folders, etc.

Checking Help/Troubleshooting Information/about:profiles shows both "Profile: default-release" and "Profile: default" the same as the main machine, same paths, folders.

I discovered there is a Tbird folder at %APPDATA%\Local and I tried copying that also, no affect.

Trying an "Import from another Thunderbird installation" and pointing it to the copy of the profile folder just results in an error:

"Uncaught (in promise) DOMException: Could not open the file at C:\Users*******\Thunderbird\Profiles\cjwu4w3o.default-release\prefs.js "

All the "How To" posts I've seen, including the one here, says this should work.

I have 4 different email accounts with years of archived emails on the main PC. I don't want to just set those up anew on the remote machine. I want access to everything, including the archives, on both machines.

Any ideas on what's going wrong, why this isn't working??
creator: remo_253
